intro: Corymborkis corymbis, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is well adapted to the local climate and is often found in sandy soils. The golden wattle is an important species in Australian flora and is also the national floral emblem of Australia.
